name: Premier Inn Stoke - Trentham Gardens

reviews.text: Clean, tidy hotel, helpful staff, spacious rooms, good location and reasonable prices, what's not to like? Premier Lodges aim for a specific price point and in this case they hit it well. Can't comment on dinner in the hotel but breakfast was good and reasonably priced. The location of the hotel next to Trentham Gardens is interesting as there's a large, local shopping center, massive garden center with, at last count, three restaurants and a decent restaurant, Dave's. Trentham Gardens itself is well worth a visit and it's not far to Wedgewood museum
reviews.title: Value for money and good location

reviews.text: We stayed here over the weekend in order to attend a wedding nearby. We had four rooms between us and could not fault the service and hospitality of the staff plus the cleanliness of all areas. Great location for visiting the potteries and other areas too. Highly recommended.

reviews.title: BEST OF PREMIER

reviews.text: This fairly new Premier Inn is on the A34 which goes south off the "D road" just off Exit 14 on the M6. It's located in what used to be Trentham Gardens, a modern building with ample car parking. They told me when I made my telephone booking that it was on the main road and there would be some traffic noise, but in fact there was just a faint hum. They also advised that the rooms had showers, not baths. It's sensible marketing to explain things in advance. Later I had to change my booking and I found their website excellent. It was an easy change, as I had kept my confirmation number, and the price for my new stay was lower, so I booked breakfast as well. Once inside the hotel, the decor has lots of the mauve associated with Premier Inns' advertising campaigns. Everything is on a tight budget, so you have to ring a bell to get a member of the reception staff. And you have to pay in advance, which to my mind is practical and sensible. It means the hotel is not afflicted by non-payers and you don't have to check out in the morning when you would rather be on your way than in a long queue. One of the lifts wasn't work and had a notice of apology on the door, but otherwise everything was smooth and efficient. My double bedroom was surprisingly large and well lit. There are no cupboards, just open shelving for cleanliness and efficiency. The first half hour of internet service is free, after which there's a £3 charge. There's a kettle and tea or coffee, but no biscuits. The shower room is system designed and seems to be made of preformed plastic, but there's a good little bench in the shower for those who need it. Even the arrangements for soap are designed for cost-control and efficiency - liquid containers rather than little bars of soap and miniature shampoos and conditioners. As a business traveller, not wanting frills or unnecessary cost, this was all entirely up my street. And the double bed was extremely comfortable, with a fresh duvet and a signposted choice of firm and soft pillows, and a well positioned TV with remote control. Breakfast also exceeded expectations. It was all serve-yourself, including the beverages, but the hot buffet was attended by willing servers who ensured that the bains-marie were reguloarly replenished with fried eggs, bacon, sausage, grilled tomatos, plum tomatos, baked beans, mushrooms and hash brown potatoes. In short, this was a very good hotel for the traveller in a hurry who wants 21st-century efficiency, with a good level of comfort at an attractive price.
reviews.title: Good value.

reviews.text: We couldn't get into the PI we wanted near Stafford so decided to book into Trentham. We were not disappointed. This is, by far and away, the best PI we have stayed in. Larger than normal rooms with plenty of space to have the double bed and 2 single beds for the kids. With in house restaurant and bar you don't have to leave the building to eat fine food and get a decent pint. Situated in Trentham Gardens Park you have a selection of shops. Easy access to surrounding area including Alton Towers and Monkey World. We would strongly recommend this hotel if you are looking for accomodation in the area.
reviews.title: Good value for money, family short break

reviews.text: We had a very clean, good-sized and comfortable room which, despite being aongside a busy road, was very quiet. Staff were all very welcoming and helpful. The breakfast was excellent - we went for the continental option but there was plenty of choice and all good quality with proper fresh coffee. For the price, it was outstanding value for money.

reviews.text: We went up to see family, and this is the first time we stayed in this hotel. Plenty of parking,friendly staff and a decent dining room along with a fantastic location made for a great stay. The only strange thing was the bathroom set up, Great shower, nice toilet, but the frosted door that you can't lock, and the sink outside made it a bit wierd. I would stay here again.

The shower was quite roomy with a curved wall that housed a built in plastic ledge/seat.

description: This 119 bedroom $10 million hotel is based within the 650 acre Trentham Estate. Family rooms, access rooms and double rooms are available for all business and leisure guests. All rooms are onsuite with Coffee and Tea making facilities, Hairdryers, Lcd Tv with freeview and air conditioning. Costa Coffe is available within the bar lounge and the Barest restaurant serves great value contemporary food. The Trentham Estate hosts a 60 outlet retail village, Italian Gardens, Garden centre,Monkey Forest, Church, and 650 acres of Woodland walks. Alton Towers , Wedgewood and Waterworld are great family attractions within close proximity to the hotel.
